Instruction: To begin, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Combine white sugar, brown sugar, flour, and salt in a saucepan. Add milk and margarine, then heat the mixture until the sugar dissolves and the margarine melts, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and let it cool.

Combine in a bowl, white sugar, brown sugar, flour, salt, and cornstarch. Add milk and butter to the mixture. Heat the combined ingredients while stirring continuously until the sugar is dissolved and the butter is melted. Let it cool and set aside.

Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce the temperature to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C) and bake for an additional 25 minutes or until the top is puffed and the edges are golden brown. Let it cool before cutting.
